etymologies: mid 19th century: from Greek isobaros ‘of equal weight’, from isos ‘equal’ + baros ‘weight’

definitions: a line on a map connecting points having the same atmospheric pressure at a given time or on average over a given period.
shortDefinitions: line on map connecting points having same atmospheric pressure at given time or on average over given period

definitions: a curve or formula representing a physical system at constant pressure.
shortDefinitions: curve or formula representing physical system at constant pressure

definitions: each of two or more isotopes of different elements, with the same atomic weight.
shortDefinitions: each of two or more isotopes of different elements
